conclusion: Determine the turns ratio of the primary coil to the secondary coil of the transformer.
The reading of the ideal ammeter in the primary circuit is 1.4 A.
The resistances on the secondary side are R1 = R2 = R3 = 50 Ω.
The reading of the ideal voltmeter across R2 and R3 is 10 V.
Calculate total resistance on the secondary side using parallel resistor formula: R_total = 50/3 Ω ≈ 16.67 Ω.
Calculate the current in the secondary circuit using Ohm's Law: I_secondary = 10/16.67 ≈ 0.6 A.
Use transformer equation to find turns ratio: n1/n2 = I_secondary/I_primary = 0.6/1.4 = 3/7.
The turns ratio of the primary coil to the secondary coil is 3/7.
